page.title: 09A Bradley Farmer's Day
page.content: Our farmer gets up at half past four and sits in his house reading the paper for half an hour.He goes out to milk the cows at 5o'clock then,when he has finished,he washes up,cleans the parlour,feeds the calves,does lame cows feet and attends to any sick cows.At 8 o'clock he has his breakfast After breakfast he telephones and decides what to do for the day,this depends on the season and weather. He does different jobs every day. Sometimes he combines or bales straw. Sometimes he makes silage or takes a journey to town. He may put chemicals or fertiliser on the field,mend fences, drains and roads,sow seeds or drives his tractor.He has his lunch at 12.30 and carries on with his jobs afterwards until 4 p.m,when he milks the cows.Tea is at 6p.m.He has two men to help him and his wife and son.
